intro: Amsinckia multispicata, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that resemble dandelion fluff. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Amsinckia multispicata is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
